div.h2: Neenah Voters Approve New High School in Referendum

div.a: Read More on Neenah Voters Approve New High School in Referendum

div.title: Free Lunch and Breakfasts Delivered During School Closure

div.h2: Free Lunch and Breakfasts Delivered During School Closure

div.a: Read More on Free Lunch and Breakfasts Delivered During School Closure

div.p:
With schools closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year and the likely cancellation of all spring sports and activities, Neenah High School will celebrate its seniors involved in extra-curriculars by inviting vehicles to drive a loop around the high school on Tuesday, April 21 at 8 p.m.
Vehicles may gather in the main lot (Lot B) in front of the high...
div.a: Read more on Celebrate Seniors on Tuesday, April 21

div.p:
Students in the Neenah Joint School District will attend a new high school and have expanded space and facilities for all students in the fall of 2023 after voters supported the Districts first successful facilities referendum in over 25 years.
With the $114.9 million amount as well as $47 million of borrowing from the District budget, the District will...
div.a: Read more on Neenah Voters Approve $114.9 Referendum

div.h3: Roosevelt and Wilson Earn School Recognition Awards
div.p:
Roosevelt and Wilson Elementary Schools have been honored as 2019-20 Wisconsin Title I School of Recognition Award recipients by the Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction.
Roosevelt was chosen in the High-Progress School category and Wilson was selected as a Beating-the-Odds School. It is the third time in four years Roosevelt has...
div.a: Read more on Roosevelt and Wilson Earn School Recognition Awards

div.p:
Jake Coenen has been named the head varsity boys volleyball coach at Neenah High School.
Coenen currently serves as Neenahs head junior varsity boys basketball coach. A Kimberly High School graduate, he was an honorable mention all-conference volleyball player for the Papermakers and played college basketball at UW-Fox Valley and Marian University. Coenen...
div.a: Read more on Coenen Named Boys Volleyball Coach

div.h3: Roosevelt Student Wins Carson Scholar Award
div.p:
Roosevelt Elementary fifth grade student Mae Lauer has been selected as the winner of a $1,000 college scholarship from the Carson Scholars Fund.
The award was made possible by an endowed scholarship donation from former Roosevelt parents Dr. Doug and Kay Horan. The Horan family will honor a Roosevelt student every year. This is the fifth year of the award. The...
div.a: Read more on Roosevelt Student Wins Carson Scholar Award

div.h3: Muraski Selected as Wisconsin Educator of Promise
div.p:
Shattuck Middle School teacher Sarah Muraski has been one of 60 Educators of Promise by the Wisconsin Department of Instruction. Muraski will have the opportunity to collaborate with all of the winners during a three-day leadership retreat in July at Fort McCoy. The group was selected for having a strong potential for educational and community leadership.
The award...
div.a: Read more on Muraski Selected as Wisconsin Educator of Promise

div.h3: Shattuck Robotics Team Qualifies for Worlds
div.p:
A team of three Shattuck Middle School students qualified for the VEX Robotics IQ Challenge World Championships after a fourth place finish at the state competition. Myah Wenzel, Lexi Dorner, and Julia Rangel earned a spot in the event, which was scheduled to be held in Louisville, Ky, but was canceled due to the COVID-19 outbreak.
It marks the second straight year...
div.a: Read more on Shattuck Robotics Team Qualifies for Worlds

div.h3: Five Selected to NJSD Hall of Fame
div.p:
Five prominent alumni comprise the Neenah Joint School Districts sixth annual Hall of Fame class in 2020. Those inducted, pending Board of Education approval, are Dr. Gary Losse, Todd Patterson, Vern Wollerman, Marti (Schreier) Wronski and Robert Yablon. The group brings the total members of the Hall of Fame to 39.
The inductees were selected by a committee...
div.a: Read more on Five Selected to NJSD Hall of Fame
